com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Class BitmapFontCache

java.lang.Object
  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.BitmapFontCache

public class BitmapFontCache
extends java.lang.Object

A BitmapFontCache caches glyph geometry for a BitmapFont, providing a fast way to render static text.

The code is heavily based on Matthias Mann's TWL BitmapFont class. Thanks for sharing, Matthias! :)

Author:
Nathan Sweet , Matthias Mann

draw

public void draw(SpriteBatch spriteBatch)
Draws the contents of the cache via a SpriteBatch. Must be called between a SpriteBatch.begin()/ SpriteBatch.end() pair.

Parameters:
spriteBatch - The SpriteBatch

Parameters:

y - The y position of the left most character's top left corner
tint - The color
start - The first character of the string to draw
end - The last character of the string to draw

setMultiLineText

public void setMultiLineText(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             Color tint)
Caches the given string at the given position with the given color in the provided BitmapFontCache. The position coincides with the top left corner of the first line's glyph. The method interprets new lines.

Parameters:
str - The string
x - The x position of the left most character of the first line
y - The y position of the left most character's top left corner of the first line
tint - The color

setMultiLineText

public void setMultiLineText(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             Color tint,
                             int alignmentWidth,
                             BitmapFont.HAlignment alignment)
Caches the given string at the given position with the given color in the provided BitmapFontCache. The position coincides with the top left corner of the first line's glyph. The method interprets new lines.

You can specify the horizontal alignment of the text with the alignmentWidth and alignment parameters. The first parameter specifies the width of the rectangle the text should be aligned in (x to x + alignmentWidth). The second parameter specifies the alignment itself.

Parameters:
str - The string
x - The x position of the left most character of the first line
y - The y position of the left most character's top left corner of the first line
tint - The color
alignmentWidth - The alignment width
alignment - The horizontal alignment

setWrappedText

public void setWrappedText(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           Color tint,
                           int wrapWidth)
Caches the given string at the given position with the given color in the provided BitmapFontCache. The position coincides with the top left corner of the first line's glyph. This method interprets new lines and causes the text to wrap at spaces based on the given wrapWidth. The wrapped text is left aligned.

Parameters:
str - The string
x - The x position of the left most character of the first line
y - The y position of the left most character's top left corner of the first line
tint - The color
wrapWidth - The wrap width

setWrappedText

public void setWrappedText(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           Color tint,
                           int wrapWidth,
                           BitmapFont.HAlignment alignment)
Caches the given string at the given position with the given color in the provided BitmapFontCache. The position coincides with the top left corner of the first line's glyph. This method interprets new lines and causes the text to wrap at spaces based on the given wrapWidth.

You can specify the horizontal alignment of the text within the wrapWidth by using the alignment parameter.

Parameters:
str - The string
x - The x position of the left most character of the first line
y - The y position of the left most character's top left corner of the first line
tint - The color
wrapWidth - The wrap width
